Worst change in a long time IMO

Riot believes Zed is in a good place of being able to outplay champions that don't have defensive options 1v1. The attack speed nerf is targeted at his split pushing and tank-busting capabilities which are strengths he doesn't need to maintain his identity. Lowering base attack speed also dramatically affects scaling into late-game and scaling with attack speed items such as BORK and Ghostblade.

Anyway, almost every lane against Zed is a skill match-up because of the way his kit works. Having an escape doesn't mean he can't be ganked. Just because he has a spammable skill-shot, that doesn't mean you can't trade with him. Just because he can dodge abilities with his ult, that doesn't mean you have to blow 3 cooldowns for free while he has it up.

I feel like Riot knows what they are doing. Keep Zed's strengths and identity of assassinating squishies with outplays intact. Get rid of his low counter-play tank-busting, speedy+safe split pushing, and reliable scaling. An assassin doesn't need those to be rewarding.

No, People are "bitching" that when you nerf the hell out of mana regen, remove the top damage item for mana based assassins and yet you leave a class of champions with manaless cooldowns incredibly strong, your options become rather limited beyond "screw it, I'll just buy zed or akali"

Think of it this way.  You say he's built to punish people who don't get defensive items.  Fine.  They just made it so if you are a mage, you are REQUIRED to fix your mana problem early.  This means that you must go Moro or (if you hate winning I guess) Athenes.  You want them to also fit in a defensive item to fight a Zed.

So, you basically want Zed's opponent to out farm him so hard as to build two items for utility and pretty much ignore any real damage scaling until the third item to even have a shot.

Meanwhile Zed bought BoTRK and said "build complete, time to wreck." at about 10-15 minutes.

Good luck with that.

THIS!! I've been saying this every where else!!

Manaless or energy champions get to IMMEDIATELY start building damage.  Mana champs will now have to worry with mana/mana regen items so much, that by the time you've got mana and regen to be viable, you can't use it because your dead-they were building damage and you have none.  

"Oh, just farm under the turret"  Yeah, because that's easy-even Korean pros have difficulty with that.  You'll get behind further because of the cs you'll miss, and your opponent will now have part of, or a whole extra item over you because you had to try to farm under a tower.  Oh, and if it's Zed you're against, then we all know that tower won't protect you at all.  If it's not Zed, then you better ward the jungle by the mid lane entrances, because the jungler will take turret aggro while the 'not Zed' kills you with damage items.

Riot nerfed this, knowing it would unbalance the game-then vaguely promises to fix it in another patch? NO!!  They should have balanced manaless and energy champs in the same patch-that is the smart and acceptable thing to do, and they didn't do it.  It's that simple-they screwed up , and people need to get off their horses and call them on it instead of defending it.

I don't think you guys understand how much this could hurt his late game though... His ult+passive amplify the damage he does through autos in his combo, not just abilities and that's why he can instagib anyone. Nerfing his base attack speed and his scaling will mean not only significantly less base damage, but also the % attack speed from BORK and Ghostblade will do a lot less.
It doesn't really matter as much if you don't buy armor because he didn't need autos to kill you, but the top laner that is doing well won't be dying anywhere nearly as easily to a fed Zed and you could probably survive his burst with an armguard's stats which is much cheaper than needing the whole Zhonya's for the active.

Whether you think it is enough or not though, Riot is definitely going about it the right way. Incrementally subtracting strengths from his kit that don't make up his identity rather than just gutting Zed because a few people whined should be applauded. I really do think people underrate Riot's balance team. Zed isn't gamebreaking, just annoying so he doesn't need to be treated with a massive gutting on his first retuning patch.

I think a lot of the complaints also revolve around mages generally having less mana sustain to deal with resourceless champions like Zed in the early game. Basically, I think most people just want mana regen buffed or resourceless champions paying a similar price
